intro: Beilschmiedia micrantha, commonly known as the small-fruited beilschmiedia, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the rainforests of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Lauraceae, which includes laurels, and is characterized by its glossy, elongated leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers followed by spherical, dark blue berries that are edible for some bird species. It typically grows to a height of 10–20 meters and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
